## What is the purpose of the change

This PR adds the ability to automatically calculate the buffer size based on the current throughput


## Brief change log

- BufferSizeCalculator integrated to StreamTask
- Created the buffer size calculator for the ability to automatically change the buffer size based on the throughput.
- Prepared Gates and Channels classes for either providing information for the calculation of buffer size and receiving the recalculated buffer size.
- Made a safe method for getting the number of buffers in the queue visible in the interface. 
- Added the rest configuration for automatic-buffer-adjustment 
-  Message for notification about new buffer size(NewBufferSize) was added

title: [FLINK-23246][table-planner] Refactor the time indicator materialization
body:
## What is the purpose of the change

The pr aims to refactor the time indicator materialization, including:
1. Move `time_indicator` materialize after `logical_rewrite` phase, which is closely before the physical optimization
2. Refactor `RelTimeIndicatorConverter` to match `FlinkLogicalRel`


## Brief change log

*(for example:)*
  - Refactor `RelTimeIndicatorConverter` to match `FlinkLogicalRel`
  - Refactor `RelTimeIndicatorConverter#visitWindowAggregate` because LogicalWindow and namedProperties should be updated after convert match_rowtime from timestamp (rowtime) to timestamp_ltz(rowtime)
  - Update `LogicalWindowAggregateRuleBase#getOutAggregateGroupExpression` because after moving `time_indicator` materialize after `logical_rewrite` phase, `LogicalWindowAggregateRuleBase` should handle time indicator case
  - Update updated xml for plan test which are expected because moving `time_indicator` materialize after `logical_rewrite` phase, which is closely before the physical optimization

## Verifying this change
Existed UT/IT

title: [FLINK-22985][table-runtime-blink] Fix NullPointerException when comparing temporal type with invalid string literal
body:
(This PR is cherry-picked from #16462.)

## What is the purpose of the change

Currently when comparing temporal type with invalid string literal, NullPointerException will be thrown as we'll first cast the string literal to the desired temporal type, resulting in a null value.

This PR fixes this issue.

In this PR, when the string literal is not in a valid date/time/timestamp format, an exception with message "String xxx is not a valid date/time/timestamp" will be thrown, otherwise the comparison code will be generated as normal.

The comparison result will be null if either operand is null, and will be true/false if both operands are not null.

## Brief change log

 - Fix NullPointerException when comparing temporal type with invalid string literal

## Verifying this change

This change added tests and can be verified by running the added tests.

## Does this pull request potentially affect one of the following parts:

title: [FLINK-23437][jdbc] Add an option to (dis)allow XA transaction multiplexing
body:
## What is the purpose of the change

Currently, JDBC XA sink creates/uses a connection per transaction.
This is to support databases with a single transaction-per-connection drivers.
However, it has an overhead and can lead to exceeding connection limits.

This change disables this feature by default and adds an option to enable it.

## Verifying this change

This is a trivial change without any test coverage.

## Does this pull request potentially affect one of the following parts:

body:

*Thank you very much for contributing to Apache Flink - we are happy that you want to help us improve Flink. To help the community review your contribution in the best possible way, please go through the checklist below, which will get the contribution into a shape in which it can be best reviewed.*

Please also understand that contributions that do not follow this guide will take longer to review and thus typically be picked up with lower priority by the community.*

## Contribution Checklist

  - Make sure that the pull request corresponds to a [JIRA issue](https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/FLINK/issues). Exceptions are made for typos in JavaDoc or documentation files, which need no JIRA issue.
  
  - Name the pull request in the form "[FLINK-XXXX] [component] Title of the pull request", where *FLINK-XXXX* should be replaced by the actual issue number. Skip *component* if you are unsure about which is the best component.
  Typo fixes that have no associated JIRA issue should be named following this pattern: `[hotfix] [docs] Fix typo in event time introduction` or `[hotfix] [javadocs] Expand JavaDoc for PuncuatedWatermarkGenerator`.

You can set up Azure Pipelines CI to do that following [this guide](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/FLINK/Azure+Pipelines#AzurePipelines-Tutorial:SettingupAzurePipelinesforaforkoftheFlinkrepository).

**(The sections below can be removed for hotfixes of typos)**

## What is the purpose of the change

From the fabric8 Kubernetes client [compatibility matrix](https://github.com/fabric8io/kubernetes-client#compatibility-matrix), v4.9.2 is no longer supporting K8s 1.18.0 and above versions. So we need to bump the K8s client to the latest stable version v5.5.0.

Please note that we also find some known bugs in v4.9.2 and have to do some temporary fixes in Flink. They will be removed after this bumping the fabric8 K8s version.

* https://github.com/apache/flink/blob/master/flink-kubernetes/src/main/java/org/apache/flink/kubernetes/kubeclient/FlinkKubeClientFactory.java#L97
* https://github.com/apache/flink/blob/master/flink-kubernetes/src/main/java/org/apache/flink/kubernetes/kubeclient/resources/KubernetesSharedInformer.java#L81

## Brief change log

* Bump fabric8 Kubernetes client version to 5.5.0
* Remove the unnecessary temporary fix for fabric8 Kubernetes client max concurrent requests


## Verifying this change

This PR does not take any concrete behavior changes. So the existing tests are enough.

title: [FLINK-21357][runtime/statebackend]Periodic materialization for generalized incremental checkpoints
body:
## What is the purpose of the change

This PR implements the materialization part for generalized incremental checkpoints [FLIP 158]. 

## Brief changelog
1. materialization is triggered periodically, set up by
PERIODIC_MATERIALIZATION_INTERVAL
The initial materialization delay equals PERIODIC_MATERIALIZATION_INTERVAL

2. we allow a certain number of async uploading file failures, determined by 
MATERIALIZATION_MAX_ALLOWED_FAILURES
- Within the # of max allowed failure, uploading will be cleaned up with the best effort and reuploading in the next materialization round
- If materialization continuous failure # >= MATERIALIZATION_MAX_ALLOWED_FAILURES, materialization failure will cause task failure.

3. There is one materialization ongoing at a time

## Verifying this change
1. Unit tests for all existing backends + checkpoint storage
2. Will enable materialization tests in FLINK-23559

## Does this pull request potentially affect one of the following parts:

  - Dependencies (does it add or upgrade a dependency): (no)

  - The S3 file system connector: (no)

title: [FLINK-23496][ci] Use MVN_GLOBAL_OPTIONS during maven snapshot deployment
body:
- splits MVN_GLOBAL_OPTIONS so that usages can use the majority of the options without the `--settings`, in case they also set it
- modify the nightly maven snapshot deployment to make use of this new property

This improves logging (by removing the download progress messages) and deduplicates optimizations (maven.wagon.http.pool).

This isn't the ideal solution, which would be to just call `run_mvn`, but I think this is a slightly safer option.

title: [FLINK-23487][flink-s3-fs] Update aws and presto-hive
body:
## What is the purpose of the change

Newer versions are required to make IRSA (IAM Role for Service Account)
work properly with S3. Since presto-hive now also directly depends on
aws-java-sdk-sts, we make sure to exclude it from presto-hive and use
our own version instead.

This fixes IRSA for s3-presto. For s3-hadoop some Hadoop-specific configuration is needed:

```
fs.s3a.aws.credentials.provider: com.amazonaws.auth.WebIdentityTokenCredentialsProvider
```

## Brief change log

* Update presto-hive from 0.187 to 0.257
* Update s3 aws from 1.11.788 to 1.11.951
* Document a bit better how to determine exclusions for presto-hive.
* Reorganize exclusions.

title: [FLINK-23541] Call StreamOperator#finish on EndOfData
body:
## What is the purpose of the change

We want to be able to bring the entire topology with a single checkpoint/savepoint. In order to do that we must be able to call finish on all operators before such a checkpoint is triggered. The idea is to emit EndOfData, which once received, triggers finish()/endInput(). After such a sequence we can trigger a checkpoint/savepoint which meets the aforementioned criteria.

This PR reworks the `stop-with-savepoint --drain` a bit so that it works correctly with the EndOfData already. Moreover it stops the legacy sources before triggering the final savepoint, so that it includes all records.


## Brief change log

See commit messages

## Verifying this change

All tests pass, especially around savepoints, such as e.g. SavepointITCase. Added a couple of additional tests.

This introduces the config option `execution.shuffle-mode` which is an enum of values `ALL_EXCHANGES_BLOCKING`, `ALL_EXCHANGES_PIPELINED`, and `AUTOMATIC`.

It replaces `table.exec.shuffle-mode` and allows to influence the `GlobalStreamExchangeMode` for both DataStream API and Table API consistently.

## What is the purpose of the change

This pull request adds support for [abfs](https://hadoop.apache.org/docs/stable/hadoop-azure/abfs.html) to talk to ADLS Gen2 (Azure DataLake Gen2) storage accounts. These are newer storage account types that hierarchical namespaces, abfs takes advantage of this newer capability. Azure recommends using abfs for reading/writing to these newer storage accounts. 


## Brief change log
- Upgrade the hadoop version to latest. Existing version that flink depends on doesn't have hadoop abfs implementation. 
- Added support for two new schemes (abfs:// and abfss://)
- Added english documentation.

- Ran existing tests to make sure there are no regressions
- Added few trivial unit tests. File system implementations are really hard to test using unit tests. Existing filesystems unit tests seems to be super thin.

title: [FLINK-22893][zookeeper] Replace NodeCache with TreeCache
body:
Replaces usages of the `NodeCache` with a `TreeCache`.

The core issue is that the `NodeCache` tries to ensure that the parents to the observed node exist. This can result in curator exceptions that crash the TM if concurrently the path is being deleted. Originally I tried to create a modified `NodeCache` implementation, but got a bad feeling when it came to maintaining said class.

I then looked at other curator caching recipes; the `PathChildrenCache` initially looked neat because it's very purpose is handling entire paths and not single nodes, but it has the same behavior as the `NodeCache` w.r.t. creating parents. 

Then I stumbled on the `TreeCache`, which after some experimenting turned out to be an incredibly flexible class. It _can_ create parent nodes, but its opt-in. It _can_ observe a node tree, but can also be configured to only consider a single node.
Even the listener interface is superior, providing more information as to the node change (added/modified/removed) _and_ connection issues (which this PR makes no use of, but still, _pretty neat_).

title: [FLINK-23429][state-processor-api] Use Path instead of Path.getPath()…
body:
… to preserve FileSystem info (backport PR#16542 to release-1.13)

## What is the purpose of the change

Fix an FileNotFoundException in State Processor API when working with savepoints on cloud storage

## Brief change log

Use Path instead of a String Path.getPath() in StatePathExtractor to preserve FileSystem info such that FileCopyFunction can copy files even if they are on cloud storage.

## Verifying this change

I've tested this fix with Azure blob storage and AWS S3.

This change added tests and can be verified as follows:

- Manually create an S3 bucket or an Azure blob container
- Configure a Flink cluster with s3-fs-presto or azure-fs-haoop plugin enabled
- Start a Flink a job and create a savepoint on S3/azure
- Use state processor API to transform the savepoint to a new one and store it in a new location on S3/azure
- There should not FileNotFoundException

title: [FLINK-23441] Remove CheckpointOptions from Snapshotable#snapshot
body:
## What is the purpose of the change

CheckpointOptions contain many fields that are not related to the backend snapshot (materialization in changelog).

In the future, if we want to separate checkpointing away from materialization (conceptually, they are indeed two different pieces as well), we do not need to provide such CheckpointOptions for each snapshotting.

## Brief change log

- Remove CheckpointOptions from Snapshotable#snapshot
- For now, CheckpointType is the only info needed; in the future, CheckpointType can be removed as well, when materialization is entirely separated from checkpointing.

## Verifying this change

Existing Tests

body:
This commit hardens the MiniClusterITCase.testHandleBatchJobsWhenNotEnoughSlot by configuring
a higher ResourceManagerOptions.STANDALONE_CLUSTER_STARTUP_PERIOD_TIME than JobManagerOptions.
SLOT_REQUEST_TIMEOUT. This ensures that the slot request times out instead of being failed by
the SlotManager.

title: [FLINK-23218][coordination] Distribute the ShuffleDescriptors via blob server
body:
## What is the purpose of the change

*This pull request is the second part of optimizing the deployment of tasks. In this pull request, we propose to distribute the cached ShuffleDescriptors via the blob server if their overall size has exceeded the threshold. For more details please check FLINK-23218. The first part of the optimization is located at #16314.*

*In this pull request we remove the cache from blob server on JobManager once it's no longer required. To remove the cache from the blob cache located on TaskManager, please check #16498.*

  - *The cached ShuffleDescriptors are stored in the blob server if its size exceeded the threshold.*

title: [FLINK-23402][streaming-java] Refactor enums for shuffle modes
body:
## What is the purpose of the change

This refactors some enum classes that are used for more or less the same purpose but in different parts of the stack with different values. It should reduce confusion and collisions with API classes.

The new naming is as follows:

```
DataExchangeMode (for network stack, remains as it is)

ShuffleMode -> StreamExchangeMode (belongs to *stream* graph and influences the data *exchange*)

GlobalDataExchangeMode -> GlobalStreamExchangeMode (belongs to *stream* graph and influences the data *exchange* but globally)
```

In docs and API we will expose the word "shuffle" also for shuffle service etc. Thus, we will add a new `ShuffleMode` enum according to FLIP-134 for the API. The API enum class will follow in the next PR.

The word "exchange" is used internally for declaring shuffles in graphs.

## Brief change log

Use the term "exchange mode" consistently.

## Verifying this change

This change is a trivial rework / code cleanup without any test coverage.

title: [FLINK-23204] Provide StateBackends access to MailboxExecutor
body:
## What is the purpose of the change
This PR provides access to mailbox executor from KeyedStateBackend

There are several places in ChangelogStateBackend that need execute actions from the task thread

DFS writer: collect so far uploaded changes; handle upload results after completion
ChangelogKeyedStateBackend: checkpointing to combine state handles upon upload completion by writer
ChangelogKeyedStateBackend: materialization take a snapshot (sync phase) and handle results of the async phase

Provide access to mailbox executor can simply threading model without a lock.

## Brief changelog
- Move the interface MailboxExecutor to flink-runtime
- Provide mailexecutor access through Environment
- Allow StreamTask to assign mailboxexecutor after initializing it.

## Verifying this change
existing tests
